title: A. Description of the entry page
change_summary: 4 changes detected: Instance bar may have additional elements beyond what was documented. Side menu has gained new items at user level 2 (e.g., Print Documents/Notifications). The Effects system and component behaviours are new concepts that may surface in the side menu. Auto-update toggle and FE/BE/DS buttons are core infrastructure elements likely unchanged.

blocks.title: BPA entry page structure - 3 sections
blocks.content:
The BPA entry page has 3 main sections:
- 'Header' also called 'instance bar' (the blue bar at the top)
- Side menu (on the left)
- Work space (in grey)
blocks.original_content:
The BPA entry page has 3 main sections:
- 'Header' also called 'instance bar' (the blue bar at the top)
- Side menu (on the left)
- Work space (in grey)
blocks.explanation: The fundamental three-section layout of the BPA entry page is a core architectural element that has not changed. The header/instance bar, side menu, and workspace pattern remains the primary UI structure.
blocks.screenshot_description: BPA entry page overview - verify the layout is visually the same, though individual elements within each section may have changed.

blocks.title: Instance bar - UNCTAD logo and FE/BE/DS buttons
blocks.content:
It consists sequentially of:
- UNCTAD and eRegistrations logo
- 3 buttons FE (front end), BE (back end) and DS (display system). When they are red, it means the corresponding component is getting updated. We can work on the system only when all buttons are green. When you put the cursor over the components name you will see the version number currently running. Versioning is made according to semantic versioning rules.
blocks.original_content:
It consists sequentially of:
- UNCTAD and eRegistrations logo
- 3 buttons FE (front end), BE (back end) and DS (display system). When they are red, it means the corresponding component is getting updated. We can work on the system only when all buttons are green. When you put the cursor over the components name you will see the version number currently running. Versioning is made according to semantic versioning rules.
blocks.explanation: The FE/BE/DS component status buttons are fundamental infrastructure indicators. The color-coding (green = ready, red = updating) and semantic versioning on hover are core platform features that remain unchanged.
blocks.screenshot_description: FE/BE/DS status buttons - verify visual appearance and tooltip content are unchanged.

blocks.title: Instance bar - Logged users and auto-update toggle
blocks.content:
'Logged users' show the number of administrators logged into BPA at that moment.
When the toggle is switched on, new feature/bug fixes are allowed to come automatically to the applications in the system.
blocks.original_content:
'Logged users' show the number of administrators logged into BPA at that moment.
When the toggle is switched on, new feature/bug fixes are allowed to come automatically to the applications in the system.
blocks.explanation: The logged users counter and auto-update toggle are administrative infrastructure features that remain part of the instance bar.
blocks.screenshot_description: Logged users counter and auto-update toggle - verify visual appearance.

blocks.title: Instance bar - User level toggle
blocks.content: User level 1 and 2 is a toggle button that minimizes and expands display of elements on the side menu bar.
blocks.original_content: User level 1 and 2 is a toggle button that minimizes and expands display of elements on the side menu bar.
blocks.explanation: The user level 1/2 toggle is a fundamental BPA navigation concept. Level 1 shows a simplified menu; Level 2 shows advanced options. This concept is still central to the platform.
blocks.screenshot_description: User level toggle - verify it still functions as a 1/2 toggle.

blocks.title: Instance bar - User ID, language, settings
blocks.content:
- User ID of the administrator logged in
- Choice of language
- Instance settings icon: 1. Settings that will apply to all services, 2. Translations icon, 3. Log-out icon
blocks.original_content:
- User ID of the administrator logged in
- Choice of language
- Instance settings icon: 1. Settings that will apply to all services, 2. Translations icon, 3. Log-out icon
blocks.explanation: The user ID display, language selector, and instance settings icon (with settings, translations, and logout) are standard BPA infrastructure elements that remain part of the instance bar.
blocks.screenshot_description: User ID, language, and instance settings - verify layout and options.

blocks.title: Instance bar - potential additional elements
blocks.content: The instance bar may contain additional elements not present in the July 2025 manual, such as notification indicators, environment labels (dev/staging/production), or audit/history shortcuts.
blocks.explanation: Given significant platform development (~9,600 commits since the manual was written), the instance bar may have acquired new elements. The audit system and notification system tools are present in the API, suggesting these features might have UI presence in the header. However, this cannot be confirmed without visual inspection of a live instance.
blocks.screenshot_description: Full instance bar screenshot showing all current elements - compare with original to identify any additions.

blocks.title: Side menu - User level 2 items
blocks.content: User level 2: Displays more elements, including Tables, Certificate builder, Print Documents, Notifications, and Messages. Print Documents allows creating and managing document templates for certificates and other outputs. Notifications enables configuration of system notifications. Messages allows managing message templates.
blocks.original_content: User level 2: Displays more elements, including Tables and Certificate builder.
blocks.explanation: The API reveals tools for print_document, notification, and message management, indicating these are first-class platform concepts with their own management interfaces. These would logically appear in the side menu at User Level 2. The original manual only mentioned Tables and Certificate builder as User Level 2 items.
blocks.screenshot_description: Side menu at User Level 2 showing all available menu items, including any new entries beyond Tables and Certificate builder.

blocks.title: Side menu - User level 1
blocks.content: User level 1: Displays only a limited number of elements on the left side menu.
blocks.original_content: User level 1: Displays only a limited number of elements on the left side menu.
blocks.explanation: The concept of User Level 1 showing a simplified menu remains. The specific items shown at Level 1 should be verified, but the principle is unchanged.
blocks.screenshot_description: Side menu at User Level 1 - verify which items are displayed.

blocks.title: Work space
blocks.content: This is the gray area which displays the contents of the elements on the side bar, and where services are built.
blocks.original_content: This is the gray area which displays the contents of the elements on the side bar, and where services are built.
blocks.explanation: The workspace concept as the main content area has not changed. It remains the gray area where service building takes place.
